- [ ] depends on: #15008
- [ ] depends on: #15015
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15008~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#15015~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
This PR is ready for review again.

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thank you for the quick review.
bors merge

Build failed:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10056167027/job/27794405949)
Now the style linter recognises a simp as non-terminal: I just squeezed it; #13791 will refactor that file anyway.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10150258379/job/28066978264)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10150258379/job/28066979043)
bors d+
Did you check that this is still applicable?
I had not. I just pushed a commit adding back @[simp]: at least #lint passes; let's see if CI has anything else to say.
(If successful, that change will be a separate PR.)
And linting passed :tada: preparing a PR now
@grunweg did you know you can run `#lint` right after the decl? It's not a global test, but it would probably have told you whether this particular issue was still a problem or not.

Yes, I do, thanks for asking!
#15015 re-simps this lemmas and a few more

could clear up another semicolon here at the same time:
```suggestion
        simp
        cases decode (Œ± := Œ±) n.unpair.1 <;> simp
```
(which is to say; I think this is deliberately a long wrapped line of semicolons, and the fix is to remove all the semicolons, not just the one at EOL)
Good point, fixed!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - style: remove more trailing semicolons
